entry.title: Combined summary - List of approved pools
entry.summary: Geir Harald Hansen, representing Bitminter, inquired about the process to get Bitminter on the list of approved mining pools at bitcoin.org for SPV Mining/Old Bitcoin Core. David A. Harding responded by asking users to add known good/bad pools to the Comparison of mining pools page on the Bitcoin Wiki. This information is needed to make accurate guesses about how many additional confirmations are needed while the situation persists. He also stated that he will update the Bitcoin.org alert to point to the Wiki page. Bitminter, a popular Bitcoin mining pool operating since 2011, has a user-friendly interface and low fees for its members. However, there are likely certain requirements that must be met to be included on the list. It is important for mining pool operators like Bitminter to be vigilant about security and reliability, and being listed on a reputable website like bitcoin.org could help build trust with potential members.A discussion thread from July 4, 2015, on the bitcoin-dev mailing list showed Geir Harald Hansen asking how to get Bitminter on the list of approved pools at bitcoin.org's SPV mining alert. In response, Jameson Lopp suggested opening an issue or submitting a pull request on GitHub. No further information or context was given in the thread.
